block.p: LEAD: Ann Marie Harrington, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ray D. Harrington of Hancock, N.H., was married yesterday to Geoffrey Blandford Shilling, a son of Dr. and Mrs. A. Gary Shilling of Short Hills, N.J. The Rev. Charles Fox performed the ceremony at the Old First Congregational Church in Old Bennington,

LEAD: Ann Marie Harrington, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ray D. Harrington of Hancock, N.H., was married yesterday to Geoffrey Blandford Shilling, a son of Dr. and Mrs. A. Gary Shilling of Short Hills, N.J. The Rev. Charles Fox performed the ceremony at the Old First Congregational Church in Old Bennington,

Ann Marie Harrington, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ray D. Harrington of Hancock, N.H., was married yesterday to Geoffrey Blandford Shilling, a son of Dr. and Mrs. A. Gary Shilling of Short Hills, N.J. The Rev. Charles Fox performed the ceremony at the Old First Congregational Church in Old Bennington, Vt.

Mrs. Shilling, 24 years old, graduated from Bates College and is a graduate student in Chinese language and literature at the University of Washington. Her father is an engineering manager at the Digital Equipment Corporation in Merrimack, N.H. Her mother, Marian Harrington, was a Republican member of the New Hampshire House of Representatives from 1982 to 1988 and is a former Selectman in Hancock.

The bridegroom, 25, a cum laude graduate of Bates College, is a computer software engineer at Microsoft in Seattle. His mother, Margaret B. Shilling, is a district sales manager in Short Hills for the Carlisle Collection, a women's clothing company in New York. His father is the president of A. Gary Shilling & Company, economic consultants and asset managers in New York.
